review: I think this is a great thing. It was very easy to set up. At first it wasn't working but then realized I had not pushed it in all the way. My onLY gripe is that you can't use it for Amazon Instant Videos but I assume that is not Google's fault. I read that you could watch Amazon Videos by casting from the Chrome browser and tried it but it was not very good - and you can't do that from an iPhone so what's the point. If I have to use my laptop I might as well just connect it directly to the tv and get a better image. For Netflix it's great. It also works great with  YouTube, the PBS app and a bunch of others. I like how well and easily it works with my iPhone and iPad.

review: I had read online about the Chromecast, and decided to give it a try. I own a android phone (Samsung Galaxy Note II), so bought it when the price was $25-$30. I am a college student, so got some sort of discount don't remember how much but was a good deal!*First Review after owning the device a few months*First thing i did was check to see if it was rootable(mine wasn't), I really wanted to be able to send local media to my Chromecast which wasn't possible early on without root. So, after finding out my Chromecast couldn't be rooted i went ahead and plugged it in. Set up was easy and painless, just asks you if you see the code on your screen and then you enter your WIFI password. Only useful apps when i got it (for me anyways) was google music and netflix. Both worked great! Now there are many great apps that I use with my Chromecast; localcast, allcast, web video caster, and much more!*Only reason i don't give it 5 stars*It seems that the Chromecast can set up its own WIFI hotspot (when you set it up it does this), I would like to be able to send local media directly to my Chromecast without going through my router and bogging it down (I own a older router, maybe with a newer higher quality router it would work better). Another benefit to this would be less lag when sending local file, since most of the time you would be right there in front of your TV to view the content.

review: Can't go wrong with Google. Simplicity, quality, and works right out the box. One thing that was a treat and I believe you Magnavox Tv lovers will enjoy. My other TVs I have to change the input source by using the remote.
